title.narrative: Bilateral Research Coop Uga Phase III; 2010-15

description.narrative: Insatsen innebär en ett-årig förlängning av nuvarande avtal. Avtalet innehåller inga nya aktiviteter utan förlänger de redan överenskomna projekt för 2010-2014. Dessa fokuseras på Masters och PhD studenter och institutionsstöd i form av medel till bibliotek, vetenskaplig utrustning, ICT, kvalitetssäkring, och en finansiell och administrativ reformprocess. Makerere universitetets Gender Mainstreaming Directorate (GMD) är ett korruptionsärende hos Sidas korruptionsenhet, baserat på ett Whistle Blower brev 2013. Ett antal åtgärder har vidtagits, såsom en extern revision, och en pågående systemrevision med särskilt uppdragt ang. GMD. Pga av pågående utredning har medel inte allokerats till GMD för 2014-2015 och enheten ingår inte i beredning till nästa fas.

The intervention is a one-year extension of the present agreement. The agreement does not contain any new activities, but rather prolongs the already agreed upon project of 2010-2014. The focus lies on Masters' and PhD students and institutional support, i.e. funding for libraries, scientific equipment, ICT, quality assurance and a financial and administrative reform process. The Makerere University Gender Mainstreaming Directorate (GMD) is a corruption case at Sida/HQ's corruptions unit, based on a Whistle Blower letter 2013. A number of actions have been taken, such as an external audit, and an ongoing system's audit with special focus on the GMD. Due to the ongoing investigation no funding has been alloctated for the GMD during the extension yea 2014-2015, and the unit is not part of the ongoing appraisal for the next phase.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: A 90% completion of MA and PhD graduates has been reached for the agreement period. The capacity to carry out research has thus been enhanced. The support to the now well equipped cross cutting research laboratories, the improved ICT facilities and library resources, have strengthened Makerere University staff in their teaching and supervision work. There is a documented enhancement of research culture, noted for example by researchers writing winning grant proposals. The strongest evidence of impact is however that in the agreement period 2015-2020 Mak has the capacity to educate PhD students locally. The support during 2010-2015 has thus lead to sustainable capacity building, stabilisation of structures and formalisation of research management. The support to the Mak Admin Reform has lead to many advances, such as shortened through put of students, improved course delivery, and research management being made more efficient.
Significant research results linked to poverty reduction have been methods of treating organic waste transforming into energy, and results regarding antibodies and malaria immunity crucial for malaria vaccine.
Further, the establishment of the innovation system and cluster concept through collaboration between small scale firms/rural farms and local government/decision makers have resulted in synergies between research and private sector development, and enhanced competitiveness of Uganda's businesses. Pedagogical skills training for Mak supervisors with Swedish university support, and enforcement of annual study plans have increased student output. Faculty/college research funds enabled mainstreaming the program beyond the Swedish beneficiaries, supporting mid-level researchers to conduct research and produce grant winning proposals for their PhD. studies from other funding agencies.
Thus, reporting and other evidence demonstrate that goals have been satisfactorily met, i.e. capacity tor train has been fundamentally strengthened, as has the ability to conduct research and produce new knowledge.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
